Package group10.client.logic

Class GameLogic

java.lang.Object
group10.client.logic.GameLogic
public class GameLogic extends Object
Singleton class that manages game logic
Author:
Alperen Caykus, Mustafa Ozan Alpay

  • Constructor Details

    • GameLogic

      private GameLogic()
      Private constructor for game logic class. Resets everything and sets ai strategy to LevelOneStrategy

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static GameLogic getInstance()
      Creates a new instance if it does not exist and assigns it to instance field
      Returns:
      Singleton instance

    • resetFields

      public void resetFields()
      Resets middle, all player cards, and all player card counts. Called on when cleaning up for the next level.

    • resetScores

      public void resetScores()
      Resets the scores of AI and player.

    • setAiStrategy

      public void setAiStrategy​(int level)
      Sets ai strategy for strategy pattern
      Parameters:
      level - Current level that AI must behave accordingly.

    • addScoreToPlayer

      public void addScoreToPlayer​(PlayerEnum player, int score)
      Adds score to player
      Parameters:
      player - Player that score will be added to
      score - Score to be added

    • getMatchType

      public MatchType getMatchType​(Card candidateCard, javafx.scene.control.TextArea logArea)
      Given a card, checks the card on top of middle and returns the match type with the tested card. Logs card placement to a text area on screen and to console.
      Parameters:
      candidateCard - Card to be tested against card on top of mid
      logArea - Text area that messages are logged to
      Returns:
      Match type of the test.
      See Also:
      MatchType

    • handleThrow

      public boolean handleThrow​(Card candidateCard, PlayerEnum player, javafx.scene.control.TextArea logArea)
      Checks match type of the thrown card and adds score to player accordingly. Logs it operation to text area of screen and to console.
      Parameters:
      candidateCard - Card that was thrown and to be tested
      player - Player who has thrown the card
      logArea - Text area that log is printed to
      Returns:
      True if there was a match. False otherwise.

    • calculateStackScore

      public int calculateStackScore()
      Calculates and returns the score of the middle stack. Also clears middle stack while doing so.
      Returns:
      Score of middle stack.

    • isHandEmpty

      public boolean isHandEmpty()
      Returns if second player's (AI) hand empty.
      Returns:
      True if opponent has no cards. False otherwise.

    • getRectangleByCard

      public static javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle getRectangleByCard​(Map<javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle,​Card> cardMappings, Card card)
      Given the card, returns the rectangle that maps to it.
      Parameters:
      cardMappings - Card mapping that contains all Card-Rectangle mappings.
      card - Card to be searched
      Returns:
      null if matching rectangle not found. Found rectangle otherwise.

    • giveMidStackCardsToLastWinner

      public void giveMidStackCardsToLastWinner()
      Upon ending of a level, gives the remaining card on the middle to player who won the last scores. Clears middle and adds score to corresponding player.

    • sendScores

      public void sendScores​(javafx.scene.control.TextArea logArea)
      POSTs the scores to server via HTTP.
      Parameters:
      logArea - log area to print logs
